text.p: Budapest club MTK became Hungarian champions on Saturday when they opened up an unassailable 10-point lead after beating bottom-placed Stadler FC 5-3.

MTK, who have lost only one match all season, now have 81 points from 32 games with two to play. Second-placed Ujpest, on 71 points, and last year's champions Ferencvaros, on 70, both have three matches left.
MTK will go into the European Champions' League, leaving their Hungarian Cup final opponents BVSC, another Budapest side, to claim a place in next year's European Cup Winners' Cup competition.
